Name: Augustin Bousfield
About: Augustin is from Bradford, UK and has played with Gurgles, Mucky Sailor, Henry Parker,  Nope and many others as well as performing as Lord Adonis, and remixing as Tomorrows Dad. He has recently been co-producing Saint Etienne’s latest album. He’s performed improv sound and noise, solo and with others at Bradford’s Threadfest, Fundada Festival in Halifax, Vespertine Festival in York and the launch of the Doctor Who exhibition at the National Science and Media Museum with jazz pianist Matthew Bourne and baritone guitarist Andy Abbott.

Name: Ben Greenwell

We have been established since 1997 and our membership comprises 32 accordion, keyboard, woodwind, strings and percussion players between the ages of 22 and 91.

Name: Martin Plock
About: Rumour has it, that on his way down from Scotland, Martin Plock wrestled a Lynx. This he did before he swam the Tay, which was flooding & in full flow, Jordan like. His songs are dredged from the lowest regions of the soul, grown on the under belly of the most perplexing thought. Listen and they will tell you what others are failing to explain to you.

About: Dougie MacLean, originally famed for writing the song 'Caledonia', has built an international reputation as songwriter, composer and extraordinary performer on his own terms. This has taken his performance to concerts and festivals all over the world and to the stages of Carnegie Hall in New York, London’s Festival Theatre and the Sydney Opera House.

Name: Main Hobby
About: Main Hobby play twisted indie pop songs built around the songwriting talent of Jem Emmett.

Name: Hexama
About: Dark experimental noise emanating from the bradford area, born out of a love for creating disconcerting sounds.

Name: Beep Beep Argh
About: Riffs, loops, beats, samples and sonic doodles, baked and road tested during lockdown by two survivors of Bradford’s post punk scene. Johnny Lorrimer and Phil Hobson combine their digital and instrumental skills to create a musical biscuit that tastes something like the ambient chill of Air, the electronic trip hop of Bomb the Bass and the industrial metal of Ministry.

Name: Mammoth Tank
About: 3 Piece original rough 'n' raw punk rock from Bradford, West Yorkshire.

Name: Forming
About: Indiedreamgazepop

Name: Queer Of Hearts
About: An absolute riot coming in your ears. Look out Yorkshire

Name: Gevaudan Dogs
About: Gevaudan Dogs (Jeh.vaw.den Dogs) is the latest punk rock ensemble from Leeds. Brainchild of songwriter and guitarist Vince Cayo, the four-piece bring energetic and impactful sounds similar to acts like Social Distortion, Stiff Little Fingers and The Clash.

Name: Echo Machine One
About: Post-punk agitprop from Bradford, UK.

Name: The Scaramanga Six
About: A biog or blurb is the thing that is asked for when someone needs a potted history or a convenient backstory. Well, for The Scaramanga Six, who’s activity spans over the last four decades, all you need to know is this – they are still here and they won’t go away.

Name: The Carol Hodge Band
About: Yorkshire-dwelling singer-songwriter Carol Hodge is a wonderful musical dichotomy. With her roots and ethics firmly set in punk as a long-term collaborator with Crass frontman Steve Ignorant, Carol is currently touring the songs of Crass around the world with The Ignorant Band, on keyboards, BVs and lead vocals. Yet Carol is also a uniquely gifted songwriter and as able to conjure up beautiful pop-infused, heart-wrenching melodies as she is screaming into the face of authority and injustice.

Name: Abandoned Buildings
About: Abandoned Buildings are five friends who like to make noise in a dilapidated old mill in Bradford, West Yorkshire. Their music is influenced by the post-industrial landscape of the city and the stark beauty of the surrounding moors.

Name: CRUMBS
About: A sort of post punk indie pop band.
